fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Sport, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives:
Our services include regulatory monitoring, policy analysis, strategic advice, media and digital communications campaigns, crisis communication, advocacy, event organization etc…  
 
The main EU policies and initiatives we have followed during the reporting period related to (in alphabetical order): Brexit, Common Fisheries Policy, Competition policy, Consumer protection, Digital single market, Energy policy, External relations, Healthcare, ICT, Single Market (eg copyright reform, gambling, free circulation, postal services), Trade policy, Transportation.

membership:
GPLUS is a member of EPACA. 
 
GPLUS is part-owned by Omnicom Inc.
goals__remit:
GPLUS is a leading EU public affairs and communications firm specialised in political and regulatory risk, advocacy, reputation building and litigation communications. 
 
Our multinational and multilingual team has the expertise and experience to guide you through the complex world of EU decision making. Our staff stems from diverse backgrounds, having held senior posts in and around the EU institutions, Brussels media and interest groups, which enables us to offer our clients informed and fresh strategic thinking and excellent networks in Brussels and Strasbourg. 
 
We have extensive experience in a wide range of EU policy areas including agriculture, energy, financial services, fisheries, healthcare, taxation, technology, transport, antitrust and trade. Getting results on complex international negotiations is one of our specialities, so we are ideally placed to help guide clients through the Brexit maze. 
 
We are also ideally placed to devise and implement public affairs and communications strategies across Europe and around the globe, thanks to our offices in Berlin, London and Paris, and a network of like-minded partner companies in European and international capitals. 
 
For further information, please see our website: www.gpluseurope.com
